Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US expresses a sense of entitlement to sit in judgement of other people's behaviors. The Netherlands judges moral action through objective criteria. Neither is incorrect. The US places an emphasis on one's underlying motivations and assumptions, whereas the Netherlands is more concerned with the observable factual phenomena.
